summary: This bill, known as the Alternatives to Prevent Addiction In the Nation Act (Alternatives to PAIN Act), aims to improve access to non-opioid pain management drugs under Medicare Part D. It mandates that qualifying non-opioid drugs have no deductible and are placed in the lowest cost-sharing tier. Furthermore, the bill prohibits the use of step therapy (requiring prior use of opioids) and prior authorization for these drugs. The bill takes effect for plan years beginning January 1, 2026.
